body_html:
Hi, I think I'm looking for the same thing. I do want to store the graph as well as the weights, but I don't want to supply a file/directory name, because I'd like to store the information in a database (Mongo). So I need a serialized representation that I can write and read myself.
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.9/how_tos/meta_graph/index.html seems to fit the bill but its usage is explained only in the context of "pure" TensorFlow (restoring a session). I'm not sure how I would have to use it to save and restore a complete DNNClassifier, for example.

body:
Hi, I think I'm looking for the same thing. I do want to store the graph as well as the weights, but I don't want to supply a file/directory name, because I'd like to store the information in a database (Mongo). So I need a serialized representation that I can write and read myself.
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.9/how_tos/meta_graph/index.html seems to fit the bill but its usage is explained only in the context of "pure" TensorFlow (restoring a session). I'm not sure how I would have to use it to save and restore a complete DNNClassifier, for example.
